We use Cytotec all the time; it usually works very well.  I hoped to just go into the different methods, pluses and minuses!My gripe is more with inductions that with the method.  Not for you; yours is needed due to the gest. diabetes.  It's pretty much standard of care to induce at term for GD if need be.  But for elective inductions, done for convenience...that's my bug-a-boo.People don't realize how often unnecessary inductions lead to an unnecessary C/S.  And if is done just for convenience it is disheartening.  The trend is more and more inductions, and we have a couple doctors who are doing elective C/S, done for no reason at all other than convenience.Don't be afraid to be induced...if there is no sign of anything happening yet, it is better to be induced that to go over and have the bigger baby often associated with GD.Get your labor bag ready--bring books if you're a reader!  If you can find sugar free lollipops, they are a good thing to have.  And SF popsicles.

That is exactly what the dr. said....standard of care for gd. I had an u/s today and they said he is up to 8 lbs. 3 oz. If I waited till he came just imagine how big he might get! Thank you for your words. I will try to be upbeat about the induction. I will just be glad when he gets here safe and sound. Thanks again.Debra :o)
